intro: Dipladenia illustris var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth dipladenia, is a climbing vine native to South America. It features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are smooth to the touch, giving it its varietal name "glabra." The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This variety is popular in gardens and as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
